passages.text: (Hey look! A dragon pup!)

(Oh no, it's afflicted with 'The Curse')
(We're going to have to take you to the Grand Wizard Abracadabraham in Lincolony, the captital! I've heard he can harness powers of relics to lift any curse!)
(Right, lets see... I think it was a Heartstone, a Crystal of Purity, and an Orb of Truesight if I'm going to cure you. Although, I've heard the Wizard may rent us some of his relics as well.)
Your new name is Wally! Lets go save your life!

You spot a broken down wagon with some people nearby. They seem to have been stuck for a while, and look half-starved.
"Please take us to the nearest town, we have plenty of money!"

options.text: > Feed them, and let them hitch a ride to town [-2 Supplies]
> "Let me take care of 'em, you want the money right?" [Geiger]

passages.text: After taking them to the nearest town, they get off and show their gratitude."We can't thank you enough, please take this for your troubles." [+200g]

Margaret works her mechanical prowess and fixes up the wagon in minutes!
"Thank you, so much! Here take this, it's all we have!" [+200g, +a good luck charm]
Geiger's domineering presence is enough for them to freeze in fear. Geiger walks over, grabs their money, and you make your merry way. [+200g]

(They probably aren't in too much trouble anyways.)
You ride on by.

You notice a speck of red a few miles down the plains. As you ride closer, the specks multiply into a raging fire, engulfing the surrounding grasslands. You can feel the heat eminating onto your face, the smoke is starting to choke you out!

options.text: > Force your way through the fire

passages.text:
You look around for another way, but the fire goes for miles in each direction.
There doesn’t seem to be a way around this, but maybe if you keep looking...

You notice a small path of cobblestone which cuts right through the fire, but the path is quickly closing. That was close, but you made it to the other side unscathed and notice a town not far away 
 That will make a good resting point
In the clearing ahead, you notice a town not far away which will make a good place to rest.
You break through the cobblestone path at top speed. Tiny embers singed the sides of the wagon, but you are otherwise unscathed.

You hold your breath for what feels like forever as your steed and wagon barrel through the raging fire.
Regret quickly settles in as you realize no sane person would have ever made this choice.

You feel the berries from before churn in your stomach.
Somehow, in your disoriented state, you notice a small path of cobblestone which cuts safely through the fire.
Besides the nagging from your stomach, you peacefully stroll through the fire.

A few moments later the world starts to take standard form again, and your stomach goes back to normal.
(I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off!)
You head towards the nearby town that was your destination.

After what seems like an eternity in that suffocating fire, you burst out into a clearing, but your wagon is in shambles. Your poor horse collapses of heat exhaustion and smoke inhalation.
At least your dragon is alright!
Thankfully, you spot a town about a mile out. There's probably a shop where you can purchase a new wagon.

After a short hike you enter the town, and to your luck find a wagon shop.
"Welcome to Stable Hands, the wagon & horse shop with the most stable of hands! My, you look like you just came out of a fire, how can I help?"

options.text: > "Thanks I need a new wagon and a horse"

passages.text: "Alright that will be 800g worth of goods for a normal horse and wagon, but if you’d like we have a special breed of horse that can run twice as fast, for 2,000g flat."

options.text: > Pay 2,000g for the special horse and wagon [-2000g]
> Pay 800g for the normal horse and wagon [-800g]
> Pay 400g and 4 supplies for the normal horse and wagon [-400g, -4 Supplies]
> Pay 8 supplies for the normal horse and wagon [-8S]

passages.text: You receive a wagon and the 'Special Horse'. Time to go fast! [+ Special Horse]
You receive a wagon and a horse, you’re ready to ride again!
"Alright listen, I'm not here to argue, you can have our lame horse if you want for free, but he is pretty damn slow. It’s not much better than walking, but it’s something"

options.text: > "I'll take the lame horse, thank you very much!" [-100g]

passages.text: You recieved a wagon and a lame horse!

You stumble upon an old man carrying a large backpack bursting to the brim. You can even see trinkets and baubles dangling out from the top flap.
(He must be travelling merchant!)
He catches your gaze and exclaims, "Good evening! Could I trouble you for a cup of tea and some company?"
"Only one item per customer, see anything you like?"

options.text: > Is that a Crystal of Purity in your pack? [Seer's Vision]

passages.text:
Only a fool would turn down a travelling merchant! You pull over for a while to make tea and company.
You have a hearty chat before he settles enough to show you his wares.

(Hmm... that looks delicious!)
You pay the merchant and receive the item.
"Ooh nice choice, that was home made!"
"Good luck on your adventure!"

(Hmm... that looks useful!)
You pay the merchant and receive the item.
"Ooh great choice, that will certainly help you in a pinch!"
"Good luck on your adventure!"

"Ah! You have a good eye! People don't really need these anymore, so I've been lugging it around for ages."
"I'd be delighted to give this one to you on the house."

A few moments later the world starts to take standard form again, and you feel normal.
(I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off!)
"Oh of course! I get it, there's been an inflation lately and prices are high. Here, take this as thanks for the good company." [+50g, +1 Supplies]
You see an army marching in formation. The kingsmen can only mean trouble, you continue your way and hope they don’t bother you.
"HAALLTTT!"

"If you’re even THINKING of passing through THIS AREA without paying the TOLL,"
"You and I are going to be having ONE VERY unpleasant chat."
(Why do army sergeants always have to scream?)
"Thank you for your SUPPORT to the KING in these HARD TIMES."

"Oh of course I can pay th- WHATS THAT OVER THERE?!"
You make a break for it while the sergeant is occupied with your clever distraction.
Hu-?! -WAIT STOP, GET THEM!!!!

You gallop as fast as you can, but the distraction wasn’t enough for a perfect escape.
You manage to get away with minor graze wounds from arrows, but that seemed to stress out your dragon.
"PLEASE GET OUT OF THE WAGON TO CHAT."

options.text: > Begrudgingly get out of your wagon

passages.text: "NOW YOU SEE HERE, WE’LL let you go JUST this ONCE, but PLEASE remember to PAY THE TOLL PROPERLY next time. AS IT IS WRITTEN: "For the UPHOLDING and KEEPING all Churches and Chapels and the DOMINION OF THE KING over these lands:"

"It is ORDERED and ORDAINED by the lords and commons assembled in parliament, that FOUR, three, TWO, or ONE SUBSTANTIAL inhabitants or inhabitants crossing such tolled lands, of every PARISH or CHAPELRY aforesaid (Having respect to the PROPORTIONS of Greatness of EVERY SUCH Parish or Chapelry)"

"Shall be NOMINATED and CHOSEN DAILY, on any tolled traveling land, by the Sergeant of every ARMY serving the KING (Which are or shall be rateable to the Repair of any such Army in the Kingdom), or the GREATEST PART OF SUCH of them as Shall be then ASSEMBLED for the CHOICE OF OFFICERS within the PARISH or army to be Churchwarden or Churchwardens or COLLECTOR OF MONIES for ROYAL DUTIES, within every such Parish or Army respectively where any such Churchwarden or Churchwardens HAVE or HATH been FORMERLY used to be NOMINATED or CHOSEN;"

"or, in default hereof, every such PARISH or traveler shall FORFEIT the Sum of 50g to the Use of the KING of the said Parish, to be recovered as is hereafter expressed; which Churchwardens or Collectors, so to be chosen, are within ONE MONTH after their CHOICE to be allowed and APPROVED of under the hands and SEALS of two OF the next JUSTICES adjoining to the Parish or Chapelry AFORESAID."

"and it is further ORDAINED, that the CHURCHWARDENS or COLLECTORS aforesaid, together with the OVERSEERS of the POOR of the same Parish or Chapelry or the greater PART OF THEM, upon PUBLIC NOTICE thereof first to be given by the Churchwardens in the said Church or Chapel,"

"Shall from TIME TO TIME make RATES, or assessments, by TAXATION of every Inhabitant dwelling or residing within such PARISH or CHAPELRY, and of EVERY occupier of Lands, Houses, Tithes Impropriate or Impropriation of Tithes, Coal-mines, or saleable Underwoods, or other Hereditaments, within the said Parish or CHAPELRY,"

"in such competent Sum and Sums of Money as THEY SHALL think fit, for AND towards THE Reparation and Maintenance of every such Parish Church or Chapel RESPECTIVELY, and PROVIDING of BOOKS for the SAID CHURCH OR CHAPEL, and of BREAD and WINE TO be USED at the ADMINISTRATION of the Sacrament...."

"ALRIGHT, just promise to pay next time and BE ON YOUR WAY" 
(What was he even talking about??)
You see the remnants of an ancient battlefield.

options.text: > "I bet I can find something valuable" [James]
> Ahah, a perfect time for my magic detector! [Magic Detector]

passages.text: You gather as many shiny objects as you can, you find shields and weapons that you think might be valuable [+100g]
You find some extremely hardtack. It’s unpleasant, but will do in a pinch [+1 Supplies]
James comes back with the crown of an old king [+250g]
Beep. Beep. Beep...
You dig at the spot you can feel something buried, and find a Heart Stone! Yes! This should fuel a Crystal of Purity!
The world starts to take standard form again, and you feel normal. (I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off!)
Beep. Beep. Beeeeeeeep...
Beepbeepbeepbeepbeepbeep!
You dig under the hotspot for the Magic Detector and find a Heart Stone! Yes! This should fuel a Crystal of Purity!!
(A field of Goldenberries! I’ve only ever heard of them! They’re supposed to be delicious!)

options.text: > Consult Plant Identification Guide [Plant Identification Guide]
> "Woah, a whole field of Goldenberries, let me make sure they're safe" [Mary]

passages.text: > You eat your fill on delicious Goldenberries, and take some for the road. [+1 Supplies]

You start feeling a little queasy... I don’t think those were Goldenberries, you throw the rest out. [-1 Supplies]
Those couldn’t have been good for you.

You start feeling a little queasy... Just as you’re getting ready to hurl, the world changes colors! You feel as though you could see things you couldn’t before, it’s a strange sensation that you’re overall not a fan of. You throw out the rest of the berries and hope this isn’t permanent.[-1 Supplies, +Seer's Vision]
Wow! Real Goldenberries, apparently the leaves and stalks are delicious too!

Wow, you almost made a mistake! These are Fool’s Goldenberries, the much more common variety that are mildly toxic. Making a jam out of them should squeeze the poison out.
Too bad they weren’t real Goldenberries. [+1 Supplies]
(I’ve only ever heard of these! Vermeil Goldenberries. Said to be a legend, those who eat these can see through natural oddities with Seer’s Vision.)

options.text: > I'm gonna have to eat that

passages.text: Mary exclaims, "Wow! I haven’t seen real Goldenberries in the field before! Let me help you gather as much as we can!"

Mary informs you, "See the clustering of the berries? It’s very similar to how Goldenberries are suppose to look, but these are Fool’s Goldenberries, you shouldn’t eat them raw, but we can make a jam out of them".
Mary's face beams in glee, "I’ve only ever heard of these! Vermeil Goldenberries. Said to be a legend, those who eat these can see through natural oddities with Seer’s Vision. Let’s eat some!"

As you ride for an abnormally long time, a mist begins to settle around the plains.
A few minutes later you cannot see even a few feet in front of you.

options.text: > Keep travelling, you’ll reach your destination eventually.
> Wait for the fog to clear. [-2 Supplies]

passages.text: The mist is all around you...

options.text: > Keep travelling, you’ll reach your destination eventually.
> Wait for the fog to clear. [-2 Supplies]

passages.text: "Ahah! I knew we'd get there eventually"
It takes a long time, but eventually the fog lifts and you are able to start moving again. [-2 Supplies]

options.text: > (I'm not sure it was worth it)

passages.text: Mary takes control of the cart and boldly pushes forwards, you have no idea how she knows where she’s going, maybe its blind luck, but it works and soon enough you’re out of the smoke.
You continue down the path unwaveringly, the way to go feels clear as day, and before you know it you’re out of the fog.
The world starts to take standard form again, and you feel normal. I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off!
While traveling you notice a blindfolded person kneeling on the ground. You get close to investigate and you find that their hands and feet are bound.

options.text: > (Well it’s not like they’re gonna know if you just leave...)
> Margaret is compassionate and will not allow you to make any other choice, we go to help [Margaret]

passages.text: "Thank you so much! Oh man I thought I was gonna die here.", says the tied up person.
"Thank you so much! Wow I really thought I was gonna die this time.", says the tied up person.
You wonder the moral implications not saving someone has. Does it make you a bad person if you didn’t tie them up? I guess it doesn’t matter anymore.

The previously bound man says, "I was searching for some rumoured ruins not far from here, I stumbled upon a group of witches who thought I was documenting their ancient rituals, not that I wasn’t taking notes, but they took me out here as punishment."
They continue, "Say you wouldn’t happen to be going to the Capital would you? I’m an excellent prospector and historian if the situation ever arises, my name is James!"
"Oh you know how it is."

"Well I was foraging for food on my way to the Captial and I stumbled upon this Mercenary Encampment. They were trading in illegal animals and I caught them. It turns out they were very dangerous, but not entirely terrible since instead of killing me outright they just left me here to die."
"Hey are you headed to the Captial? Oh I bet you need an expert survivalist/navigator? My name is Mary and I think we’d make one hell of a team."
"Perfect!"
And thus, you have gained a new companion.

On the trail you ride up to a very ambiguous mob. They seem to be trying to say something about the king, but it’s hard to tell what. Some of the mob have banners holding up the king’s face, others have pitchforks and torches. There's few smatterings of signs saying "We have strong feelings about the king!"

"Oy you!" 
 The mob’s attention turns to you. 
 "What do you think, are you for the King? Or against him."

The mob seems to take a second before someone in the back shouts 
 "Yeah what he said!" 
 "Yeaaahhhhhhhh!" 
 "We should burn the witch!" 
 "Yeaaahhhhhhh!" 
 You’ve seemed to unite the mob under one ideal, great job!!

The mob seems to take a second before someone in the back shouts 
 "Yeah what he said!" 
 "Yeaaahhhhhhhh!" 
 "March on the Kingdom!" 
 "Yeaaahhhhhhhh!" 
 You’ve seemed to unite the mob under one ideal, great job!
You hear a strange whisper, a song! No... a chant? It's coming from the woods...

options.text: > We're on a time limit here
> There's something I need here... [Seer's Vision]

passages.text: The sounds get louder and louder as you get closer and closer. Suddenly an arm comes through the bushes and pulls you into a clearing with a bunch of witch cultists dancing around a fire! There is an Orb of Truesight being forged atop the fire!

"Te’lu Krakate memori wah’lu!!" 
 The cultists don’t stop dancing, in fact, you feel the urge to start dancing as well, and before you know it, you’re humming and chanting and are dancing like you never knew you could!

options.text: > If only I could get closer to that Orb...
> We need to get out of here... NOW

passages.text: You continue to dance freely, you can’t help but feel like you’re forgetting you need to do something.

options.text: > If only I could get closer to that Orb... [+5 Curse Progression]
> We need to get out of here... NOW

passages.text:
You dance yourself closer and closer to the fire, and when the opportunity strikes SNATCH.. The fire starts to dim and die. 
 You start to feel intense pain, but  you can bear it. The rest of the cultists however are doubled over in pain screaming.

options.text: > Yeah now's a perfect time to leave!

passages.text:
You quickly rush out of the small wooded area and back to your wagon. The proximity to strange magics have worsened the curse 
 That seemed dangerous?

options.text: > At least we got the orb!

passages.text:
Definitely not going to stick around any longer, you resist the impulse to dance and face the fire. 
 But you can’t... Just then you have this brilliant idea, and staring directly at the fire, you moonwalk all the way to safety. That was a close one.
You ignore the strange chanting, probably a wise decision.

There’s a strange cave here, I bet there’s treasure in there! But it could be very dangerous..

options.text: > "Looks like an old dire bear den, it shouldn’t be dangerous anymore." [James]
> There’s something magic in there... [Seer’s Vision]

passages.text: It’s a dark cave and it’s hard to tell what’s what. You pick up a few shiny stones hoping they’re worth something. [+50g]
Hey, the magic detector is going off. It seems to be pointing directly at an off color rock. You take the rock with you and realize you found a Heart Stone!
You and James head into the den, it’s far too dark for you to see anything, however James is immediately pulled towards a large quantity of rosy rocks.
"It’s orichalcum! Loads of it! We’re going to be rich!" [+300g]
Sometimes, it’s better not to take risks.
It’s a dark cave, but you can sense exactly where you need to go. You pick up an off color rock, and you know that you need it. You found a Heart Stone!
The world starts to take standard form again, and you feel normal. I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off!

The sun is burning bright on a nice day 
 FWWWHIIPPPP- An arrow whizzes near your face, so much for a nice day. Six bandits pop out of nowhere. 
 "Your money or your life!"
Wait why am I listening to their choices?

options.text: On second thought, yeah my money is fine [-200g]

passages.text:
You successfully surprise them and break through their formation, you think you’ve gotten away safely when you see your horse has an arrow in its ass. 
 You need to use supplies to make your horse feel better [-2 Supplies]

It takes a lot of bravado to try to handle 6 armed bandits, unfortunately it doesn’t go well for you. They leave you wounded, but alive 
 They take all the money they find on you and some of your supplies [-250g, -2 supplies]

The mighty mercenary leaps out of the wagon and eviscerates the bandits in mere seconds 
 perhaps he is worth every penny. The bandits had some supplies on them [+3 Supplies]
You don't give them all of your money and insist that it’s all that you have, the suckers bought it!
There’s a strange looking contraption lying broken on the ground. You can’t seem to make any which way out of what it is. It’s far too large to take with you, what could it be?

options.text: "Let me have a look at it" [Margaret]

passages.text:
Margaret looks like a magician as she reassembles the broken parts and turns it on within mere seconds! 
 It’s a much more efficient means of travel we’ll be able to get there in no time!
You stumble upon a mercenary encampment, they look tough, best not get into any sort of tussle.

options.text: "These guys aren’t good people, we should get out of here fast" [Mary]

passages.text: "You guys have good coin then? I’ll join you, I’m the best there is. Name’s Geiger. Pleasure to make your acquaintance."
You bolt extremely quickly away, they didn’t seem to put up too much of a chase, but they did seem a bit ticked that you left. Thank goodness you got out of there
You start to leave but you aren’t quite fast enough. A large mercenary stands in your way.

"Hold on now, don’t think you can just go window shoppin’ anywhere n' get away with it. 
 Buy the product or not, we're gonna need some coin for our time." 

 This is obviously robbery, but what else can you do?

options.text: Window shopping?! That was uh- a test! You're hired [-250g]
A few pennies for your troubles then [-50g]
I have no money, please don't hurt me take my food instead [-1 Supplies]

passages.text: "Perfect, trust me I’m well worth the price. Name’s Geiger. Pleasure to make your acquaintance."
"Alright then ‘ave a good day!" The giant mercenary smiles, but you know you won’t "‘ave a good day." defiantly so.

You arrive at a town that you thought was supposed to be bustling with life. Instead you find a ghost town that looks like it’s been abandoned for a few year. The place is giving you the heebiejeebies.

options.text: Take what you can and leave

passages.text: You find a storehouse with a few supplies [+1 Supplies]
You find some nobles house and take a few of the small shiny objects [+50g]

"This was an old witches town that was thriving until the reign of the new king. The king sent an army to force the witches out and the town has been abandoned ever since. A long line of prestigious witches used to live here." James runs off to a manor near the center of town and comes back with bundles of old spell tomes and gold [+300g]
You wander up to a manor near the center of town, and in one of the spires you find an Orb of Truesight! [+Orb]
The world starts to take standard form again, and you feel normal. I think the effects of those berries have finally worn off!

There seems to be a revolution going on in this town. People have taken up arms and a guillotine and have flooded the streets. The nobles are screaming for help from the top of their villas. This seems like a domestic dispute, but nobles are known for having lots of wealth...

options.text: Help the people execute the nobles
"I can take care of this mob" [Geiger]

passages.text:
You push into the crowds and screaming "VIVA LA REVOLUCIÓN".
After making your way to the nobles and you force them into the guillotine.
After spilling the nobles blood and splitting the nobles wealth equally between everyone, you make a profit of 17g [+17g]
You shout "HEY, THEY’RE GETTING AWAY" and point in the opposite direction. The crowd blindly follows your orders and you manage to catch up to the nobles who are fleeing in the opposite direction.
With the grace of a giant man with a giant sword, Geiger cleaves through large swathes of townsfolk. You watch in horror from your wagon, unable to lift a finger against the carnage that unfolds.
You decide not to get involved in the politics of this dangerous town and just keep riding.

The nobles scoff,
"Money? How am I supposed to know you’re the one who caused that distraction, besides, it’s my money and I deserve it. Now bugger off!"

When the dust (or rather, the mist of fresh blood) settles, Geiger jaunts back toward the wagon, 
"Mm, got the nobles as well, I’m keepin’ his money though."
(You begin to see why there was a revolution...)
You don’t dare to say anything and set back onto the road.
A lone shop is set up in the middle of a field in what’s supposed to be town. I guess since the shopkeep lives here it’s technically a town?
"Hello! Welcome to Shopton, where we've got anything and everything under the sun! What can I get for you?"

options.text: I think I have everything I need

passages.text: "Ooh sorry we’re fresh out of those, is there anything else I can get you?"
"Ooh sorry we’re fresh out of those, is there anything else I can get you?"

passages.text: "I could interest you on our special on supplies right now!"
"3 supplies for 600g."
"Thank you, come again!"
"Come back soon!"
The local tavern has some 'for hire' signs, getting some crew on this journey could be very helpful.

options.text: Ask about ‘Geiger, Mercenary, Merciless, Strongest man alive, 150g’
Ask about ‘Mary, Survivalist, Navigator, Buckets of fun! 150g’
Ask about ‘James, Historian, Prospector, Share the wealth! 150g’
Ask about ‘Margaret, Mechanic, Expert at it, Kind of shy 150g’

passages.text:
"Ah yes Geiger, very dangerous man, good person to have on your side, you sure you want him?" 
 -Tavernkeep

"Mary’s a fun one, honestly good company, but very good at her job, you sure you want her?" 
 -Tavernkeep

"James is an upright fellow and an outstanding gentleman. I’ve never seen someone leave the company of James poorer than when they began, you sure you want him?" 
 -Tavernkeep

"Ah Margaret, she’s a good person, really compassionate, a skilled mechanic thats always good in a pinch, you sure you want her?" 
 -Tavernkeep
"Great I'll send her your way in the morning!"
